meanings.sent1: The closings of the store happen every evening.
meanings.sent2: I heard the closings of the doors as the shop prepared to close.
meanings.sent3: The closings of the windows made the room feel stuffy.
meanings.sent4: Her silence was like the closings of a heavy door, final and resolute.
meanings.sent5: The closings of the book echoed through the empty library.

meanings.definition: The final part of a speech or event
meanings.sent1: His speech ended with powerful closings that left the audience inspired.
meanings.sent2: The closings of the ceremony included a heartfelt thank you to all attendees.
meanings.sent3: The closings of his magic show involved a disappearing act that amazed everyone.
meanings.sent4: The closings of the play were so emotional, they brought tears to the audience's eyes.
meanings.sent5: The closings of her presentation were met with enthusiastic applause.

meanings.definition: The end of a business day or operation
meanings.sent1: At the closings of the store, employees start cleaning up for the night.
meanings.sent2: The closings of the restaurant signal the end of the dinner rush.
meanings.sent3: The closings of the office always bring a sense of relief after a long day.
meanings.sent4: The closings of the market indicate the end of trading for the day.
meanings.sent5: The closings of the theme park mean it's time to head home.
